sen.e: Ichian YOKOHAMA (1550 - Sep 5, 1596) was a daimyo (Japanese feudal lord) during the Azuchi-Momoyama period.

sen.j: 秀長の没後は、養子豊臣秀保に小堀正次とともに家老として仕えたが、文禄3年（1594年）4月、秀保がにわかに没して豊臣大納言家は断絶した。
sen.e: After the death of Hidenage TOYOTOMI, Ichian served with Masatsugu KOBORI as chief retainers to Hidenaga`s adopted son Hideyasu TOYOTOMI and, when Hideyasu died suddenly in Apr 1594 the TOYOTOMI family's grip on the Dainagon (chief councilor of state) role was severed.

sen.e: Ichian is said to have resided in the Tokiwa district abutting the main keep of Koriyama Castle (Yamato Province) so was said to have been called the `Bishop of Tokiwa` however the area was renamed when the Yanagisawa clan took control of the domain in the Edo period.

The 'Tokiwa Kuruwa' (walls of a castle) abutting the main keep of Koriyama-jo Castle(Yamato Province) were said to have been called 'Honmaru Hoin Kuruma,' sinceIchian was given a yashiki (mansion of a feudal lord) here, but they were renamed when the Yanagisawa clan took control of the domain in the Edo period.
